title: Few-Shot Learning for Multilingual NLP in Low-Resource Languages
venue: Workshop on NLP for Low-Resource Languages at ACL
abstract: This paper presents a few-shot learning approach for multilingual NLP tasks in low-resource languages, demonstrating significant improvements over traditional transfer learning methods.
content: This paper presents a few-shot learning approach for multilingual NLP tasks in low-resource languages, demonstrating significant improvements over traditional transfer learning methods. We introduce a novel meta-learning framework that can quickly adapt to new languages with minimal labeled examples. Our approach leverages cross-lingual representations and contrastive learning to improve generalization across typologically diverse languages. Experiments on named entity recognition, part-of-speech tagging, and sentiment analysis across 15 low-resource languages show consistent improvements over strong baselines, especially in the 10-50 examples regime.
citationFormat: Le, D., Garcia, S., & Khan, A. (2023). Few-Shot Learning for Multilingual NLP in Low-Resource Languages. In Proceedings of the Workshop on NLP for Low-Resource Languages at ACL 2023, pp. 112-123.
